definition: to break the law and commit crimes (idiom); malefactor/evildoer/to perpetrate outrages
variant of 為|为[wei4], because of/for/to
because of/for/to
variant of 為|为[wei2]/as (i.e. in the capacity of)/to take sth as/to act as/to serve as/to behave as/to become/to be/to do
as (in the capacity of)/to take sth as/to act as/to serve as/to behave as/to become/to be/to do/by (in the passive voice)
abbr. for 非洲[Fei1 zhou1], Africa
to not be/not/wrong/incorrect/non-/un-/in-/to reproach or blame/(colloquial) to insist on/simply must
worker/workshop/(slang) troublesome/high-maintenance (person)
to do/to grow/to write or compose/to pretend/to regard as/to feel/writings or works
bad/wicked/evil/Kangxi radical 78

sentences.english: He gravitated to the Outer Rim, where he eventually began racing with outlaw swoop gangs.
sentences.chinese: 他流落到外环，开始和为非作歹的飞车党鬼混。

sentences.english: He has committed many towering crimes.
The presence of the police frightened many criminals out of attempting further crimes.
sentences.chinese: 警察的出现使许多犯罪分子不敢继续为非作歹。

sentences.english: The motive for most wrongdoing, though, tends to be greed.
sentences.chinese: 然而，骇客为非作歹的动机，大多是贪婪。

sentences.english: A group of lawbreakers are rampaging around in the centre of the city.
sentences.chinese: 一群不法之徒正在市中心为非作歹。

sentences.english: The wolves threatened to civilize the rabbits if they didnt behave.
sentences.chinese: 狼威胁说，如果兔子继续为非作歹，它们将施以管教。

sentences.english: It is easy for him to be used as a cat's paw of evil-doing.
sentences.chinese: 他很容易就被人利用，成为别人为非作歹的工具。

definition: to run amok (idiom); to commit outrages
to oppress the people/to act tyrannically
to flout the law
to prey on the people
not to shrink from any crime (idiom); to commit any imaginable misdeed
tyrannical abuse (idiom); riding roughshod over people
to oppress/to rule as a despot/to tyrannize
to act as accomplice to the tiger/to help a villain do evil (idiom)
to do evil
willfully slaughter the innocent (idiom)
see 恣意妄為|恣意妄为[zi4 yi4 wang4 wei2]
with no regard for law or discipline (idiom); flouting the law and disregarding all rules/in complete disorder
to take advantage of one's position to bully people (idiom)/to kick people around
lit. helping tyrant Zhou 商紂王|商纣王[Shang1 Zhou4 wang2] in his oppression (idiom)/fig. to take the side of the evildoer/giving succor to the enemy
hoodlum/bad guy
lit. strung through and filled with evil (idiom); filled with extreme evil/replete with vice/guilty of monstrous crimes
